cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across Hispaniola and Cuba, forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico Monday night and curve northwest toward the northwest Gulf Coast (Texas–Louisiana area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central to southwest Louisiana coast (near Morgan City–Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch currently limited to the Florida Keys, central Bahamas, and parts of Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect for portions of the Dominican Republic, Haiti, SE Bahamas, Turks and Caicos, and eastern Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward across coastal Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤17%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts possibly 35–45 mph mid-week if track shifts west
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible on the upper Texas coast; values above 3 ft currently unlikely
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain; widespread 4-inch totals not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning late Tuesday
